</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Create a dialog which is defined either in the mission's [[description.ext]], in the campaign's description.ext or in the global [[Resource.cpp/bin|resource.cpp]]. The given name has to be the class name used in one of these files. If another dialog is already opened, the desired dialog is created as a child dialog of the one already opened. </value></part><part><name>DESCRIPTION</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> '''createDialog''' dialogName </value></part><part><name>SYNTAX</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> dialogName: [[String]] - class name used in the description.ext / resource.cpp </value></part><part><name>PARAMETER1</name>=<value>

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Boolean]] -  
true when the dialog was created successfully </value></part><part><name>RETURNVALUE</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_ok = [[createDialog]] "RscDisplayGame";
[[if]] (!_ok) [[then]] {[[hint]] "Dialog couldn't be opened!"};</code> </value></part><part><name>EXAMPLE1</name>=<value>
____________________________________________________________________________________________

</value></part><part><name index="6"/><value>  [[displayCtrl]], [[createDisplay]], [[closeDialog]], [[dialog]], [[displayNull]], [[controlNull]], [[ctrlCreate]], [[displayParent]] </value></part><part><name>SEEALSO</name>=<value>

<dd class="notedate">Posted on July 29, 2017 - 09:04 (UTC)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Killzone Kid|Killzone Kid]]</dt>
<dd class="note">A user dialog created with [[createDisplay]] over mission display ([[findDisplay]] 46) will stop [[displayAddEventHandler|display event handlers]] added to mission display from firing. However if it is created with [[createDialog]] then the event handlers continue to work.
</dd>
</dl>
